intro: Topea, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a species native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are small, narrow, and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. Topea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
